title: Google\Cloud\Core\Iam\PolicyBuilder
name: PolicyBuilder
description: Helper class for creating valid IAM policies

methods.name: __construct
methods.description:
Create a PolicyBuilder.

To use conditions in the bindings, the version of the policy must be set to 3.

resources.title:
Using Cloud IAM Conditions on buckets

Example:
```
$policy = [
    'etag' => 'AgIc==',
    'version' => 3,
    'bindings' => [
        [
            'role' => 'roles/admin',
            'members' => [
                'user:admin@domain.com',
                'user2:admin@domain.com'
            ],
            'condition' => [
                'title' => 'match-prefix',
                'description' => 'Applies to objects matching a prefix',
                'expression' =>
                    'resource.name.startsWith("projects/_/buckets/bucket-name/objects/prefix-a-")'
            ]
        ]
    ],
];

$builder = new PolicyBuilder($policy);
```

methods.name: setBindings
methods.description: Override all stored bindings on the policy.

methods.name: addBinding
methods.description:
Add a new binding to the policy.

This method will fail with an InvalidOpereationException if it is called on a Policy with a version greater than 1 as that indicates a more complicated policy than this method is prepared to handle. Changes to such policies must be made manually by the setBindings() method.

params.name: members
params.description: An array of members to assign to the binding

exceptions.description: if the policy's version is greater than 1.

methods.name: removeBinding
methods.description:
Remove a binding from the policy.

This method will fail with a BadMethodCallException if it is called on a Policy with a version greater than 1 as that indicates a more complicated policy than this method is prepared to handle. Changes to such policies must be made manually by the setBindings() method.

params.name: members
params.description: An array of members to remove from the role

exceptions.description: if the policy's version is greater than 1.

params.name: etag
params.description: used for optimistic concurrency control as a way to help prevent simultaneous updates of a policy from overwriting each other. It is strongly suggested that updates to existing policies make use of the etag to avoid race conditions.

methods.name: result
methods.description: Create a policy array with data in the correct format.
